ygData.subject: Re: [The EverQuest Tavern] WANT EQ
ygData.msgSnippet: To break it down into layman s terms, the game relies heavily on data transfer between your PC and its server. Therefore, connection speed is paramount. ;)
ygData.messageBody:
"To break it down into layman's terms, the game relies heavily on data
transfer between your PC and its server. Therefore, connection speed
is paramount. ;) Dial-up is one of the slowest connections you can
have (if you use AOL I pity you). "

Thanks man. Believe me, I've been wanting mom to switch to MSN for quite a while now, but no, she wants this easy **** that can't access quite a few things because it's cruddy ao****!

If you really want to spend the money, you could upgrade to DSL. It's
roughly about the same price you'll pay for AOL (depending on where
you get DSL from), or if you have Cable service available, get that.
Dial-up transfers up to 56K per second. DSL and Cable are 10 times
faster than that and more if you have a good modem and cable.

***********************
Jack Bullions


> It works on dialup, but my boyfriend got cable modem to play
recently and he LOVES it even more now, I am still stuck with dialup
and see the different in speed and most defidently graphics.
> BADBRAD112 <badbrad112@y...> wrote:Hi everyone, i just wanted to
ask some questions. Does this game work well at all using dail up,
cause thats all i got right now and i was wonering if i am gonna need
to upgrade to cable internet to play this game, if any of you out
there use dail up, does it run fast or what?
>
> thanks
